intro: Nigella elegans, commonly known as the Persian flower or love-in-a-mist, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and Central Asia. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue or purple petals and fluffy, seed-producing heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–30 cm and thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and the plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. Nigella elegans is also valued for its historical use in traditional medicine and as a spice in some cuisines.
